Judul: THE EFFECT OF ADDITIONAL EDUCATION AND DIETARY INTERVENTION ON PATIENTS WITH HYPERPHOSPHATEMIA
Abstrak:
Background and Objective: Hyperphosphatemia is an electrolyte disturbance in which there is
an abnormally elevated level of phosphate in the blood from the normal range of 2.5-4.5 mg/dL.
Hyperphosphatemia is a commonly present condition among chronic kidney disease patients.
This is normally due to the degradation of the kidney function among these patients. Chronic
kidney disease (CKD) is the progressive loss of renal function over a period of time such as in
months or years. Due to the tremendous reserve capacity of the kidneys, the abnormalities in
renal function are not detected until 75% functional capacity is lost. The additional education and
dietary intervention helps the patients in treating hyperphosphatemia patients via non-
pharmacological method. This study was carried out to evaluate the success of dietary control in
reducing phosphate level. Method and Study Design: The research is a descriptive design by
collected data retrospectively at Rumah Sakit Ginjal Ny. RA Habibie, from March 2013 until
July 2013. Results: The total patient involved in this study was 24 chronic renal failure (CRF)
patients where they were divided into two groups, group A (study group) and group B (control
group), group A showed there is a significant difference between the mean and the P value of
0.0001 while the group B showed no significant difference between the mean and the P value of
0.1024, this shows the additional education and dietary intervention helped the patients in
reducing their phosphate level. Conclusion: The reduction in phosphate level among
hyperphosphatemia patients shows that hyperphosphatemia can be treated non-pharmacolo-
gically as well educating the patients on their condition and ways to improve it
